html: Again entering the temple, Hezekiah addresses Jehovah as he who “sits enthroned between the cherubim”—that is, in the midst angelic beings who dwell in Jehovah’s presence (Genesis 3:24; Psalm 80:1; Ezekiel 10:1-22 ; cf.Isaiah 6:2). When Moses made the Ark of the Covenant from which Jehovah spoke with him, he thus constructed a “mercy seat” of pure gold on top of the ark featuring two cherubim, one on each side (Exodus 25:17-22; 37:6-9). As the God who “made the heavens and the earth,” who is “over all the kingdoms of the earth,” Jehovah can’t be compared to the gods of the nations.
